review: If a Roku 3 is a bit much for you, and you don't have another method of streaming to your tv, then a Chromecast is a great, inexpensive alternative.Pros:Low profileOnce paired, reacts fairly reliablyFast streaming capability (I can watch HD movies just fine, so it is capable of at least that)Cons:A bit finicky. What I mean is that I occasionally have to just reset the device and connect it to my wireless network again. It fairly often doesn't show up when I first scan for devices in my chromecast app (same across all our devices: Kindle, Android phone, and Apple phone).Limited in terms of services available: Cannot stream your own media. Has to be through a sometimes poorly supported app (off the top of my head, it supports Youtube, Netflix, HuluPlus, and Crackle)Overall, great for 30 bucks, and a nice novelty to be able to sort of easily control the device through your phone/tablet.
